{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60471].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, the Bulk Change permission can be configured in the global permission page and once the respective group has been granted to this permission, the group members will be able to perform a bulk change to all tickets in all projects. This would also allow them to Bulk change tickets for projects they shouldn't be administrating but have permission to edit single tickets.

h3. Suggested Solution
- to use the current Bulk Edit interface (in Issue Navigator) but only display the Bulk Edit option if you have Bulk Edit permission to all projects contained in your search result
- another option would be to enable it or when the project filter is selected & you filtered on projects where you have Bulk edit rights only. This might be better performing as you wouldn't need to check each individual ticket rather the projects in the filter
fields.summary: Ability to have Bulk Change permission on project level
Ability to Rename Project Types in JIRA 7

h3. Problem Definition
* Recently there was an issue with Domino LDAP integrated with JIRA where [Users with special characters in their full name are not able to log into JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Users+with+special+characters+in+their+full+name+are+not+able+to+log+into+JIRA]
* The [Supported Platforms page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/adminjiraserver071/Supported+Platforms] does not show supported LDAP engines 

h3. Suggested Solution
* Include a list of LDAP engines that are supported in the [Supported Platforms page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/adminjiraserver071/Supported+Platforms]
 !ldap.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Show LDAP Engine supported in the Supported Platforms Documentations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60468].
  {panel}

Scenario:
issue is created with work to be done by team
team member A pulls up issue
team member B pulls up issue
team member A clicks 'Assign to me' and starts working
team member B clicks 'Assign to me' and starts working
duplicate work! Possibly bad data in database, embarrassing customer interaction, etc

It would be nice if team member B got a confirmation indicating that the issue had been updated recently and that the issue was currently assigned to A. Did B still want to 'Assign to me' [yes] [no]?

The POST could send the page's current notion of assignee and if that did not match the actual assignee, then the confirmation would be generated instead of simply updating the assignee.
fields.summary: 'Assign to me' link should prompt *if* assignee has changed since page load

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
GMAIL has API limits that are causing mail handlers to be throttled. When the mail handler makes several imap request to the same mail box. Gmail will begin to throttle that the request to that account. See Manage your IMAP clients in [Bandwidth Limits|https://support.google.com/a/answer/1071518?hl=en]. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Improve the Default Mail handler when using imap gmail accounts to decrease the amount of request. 
 
h3. Workaround 
Increase the interval delay for the gmail mail handler.
fields.summary: Increase the default setting for the mail handler.

The link address for a permlink has a lot of redundant information. Links are usually not so long that they cry out for a URL shortening service but long enough that users don't want to copy/paste them. As an example:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-22082?focusedCommentId=205523&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-205523

is functionally equivalent to

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-22082?focusedCommentId=205523

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, JIRA Cloud has a default Email Handler, which creates comments directly in issues.
This email handler cannot be disabled and if it's removed, it is recreated, not providing any way to avoid issue's being commented from emails.

h3. Summary
Regardless of fields selected under configure fields, when using a custom layout tabs are not displayed, per the screens configuration.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# [Add a tab to a screen in the *Configure Screen* | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/defining-a-screen-776636475.html#Definingascreen-Configuringascreen'stabsandfields]
# On the screen select *Configure Fields*
# For *Show Fields* Choose custom
# Select Fields displayed Under Both Tab Options in Dropdown

The Tabs will be displayed if a field under the tab is chosen.

No Tabs are displayed and all selected fields are displayed on the default modal popup screen view
!Screen Shot 2016-04-04 at 9.22.59 AM.png|thumbnail!

Switch *Show Fields* to all to display the configured tabs.

h3. Summary

If a user's username contains Korean characters or spaces (likely other non-ascii characters will fail as well) then a JIRA Core Board will go into an infinite refresh or reload loop.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new 'Project Management' project type.
# Create a user, or edit a user so that their username contains Korean characters (e.g. 안녕하세요 세계)
# As that user attempt to access the JIRA Core Board.

h3. Expected Results

Board loads

h3. Actual Results

Board goes into an infinite refresh loop.

h3.Workaround

No known workaround apart from renaming the user to something with ascii characters
fields.summary: JIRA Core Board in infinite refresh loop for Korean usernames or spaces in usernames

fields.description:
When developing a JIRA plugin that uses an external datasource (JTDS driver), the following error is thrown when establishing a database connection:

{noformat}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unable to create EvictionPolicy instance of type org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.pool2.impl.DefaultEvictionPolicy
{noformat}

This is due to an Apache commons pool bug: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/POOL-289

Tomcat absorbed this patch in version 8.0.26: https://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-8.0-doc/changelog.html

We have verified that dropping JIRA 7.1.2 into a Tomcat 8.0.26+ container solves the problem. 

What are the plans for a Tomcat 8 update? If a 8.0.26+ update is planned, what JIRA version is it planned for?

We can't drop in a new version of the Apache common pool library directly into our plugin (via Import-Package) because internally Tomcat uses their own version of the common pool classes. (org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.pool2 vs. org.apache.commons.pool2)
fields.summary: Tomcat upgrade (8.0.26+) needed for Apache commons pool EvictionPolicy error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60429].
  {panel}

h3. Issue Summary

When a user sets statistic for the JIRA Pie Chart report to use issue type, JIRA filters parent issue type and sub-task as different segments.

This can lead to skewed results especially if user is trying to get specific information on particular issue types and expects all work done even in the child to be accounted for under it's parent.

h3. Expected Result
JIRA would merger each subtask value directly into it's parent.

h3. Actual Result
JIRA separates sub task from their parents making them calculating them as a segment on it's own.
fields.summary: Allow merging of Sub-Task to Parent in JIRA Pie Chart Report.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60417].
  {panel}

AS A managing software architect and engineering peer, I WANT the Activity Stream Gadget's global filter for Update Date to store the relative date syntax SO THAT the stream remains current.

The filter allows options like is, is before, is after, and is between.  When I type in a value like is after -1d, the syntax is immediately auto converted to a static date value such as March 31, 2016.  This means that I will have to update the activity stream every day to continue to get comments from just the last day. 

My team documents the work they plan to do each day on the JIRA  each morning and documents progress updates throughout.  The activity stream makes it easier for local and global peers of the development team to monitor planned work, accomplished work, and unplanned work.  Today we work around this bug by streaming the last 5 updates for users without regard to update date.  We only do 5 so as to prevent seeing too many results from previous days.  However, this also forces us to click the 'more' button repeatedly to consume the previous day activity.

This seems to relate to https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/STRM-1804.
fields.summary: Filter / Display Option improvements for dates to help automate team scrum

h3. Summary
((i) It is a trivial bug but would like to report it so that it will be fixed in the future)

500 error occurs when you click "Associate" button in "Associate Issue Type Scheme" without selecting any projects. See also the screenshot.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in to JIRA as an administrator
# Go to "JIRA Admin" -> "Issues" -> "Issue type schemes"
# Choose an Issue type scheme which has not associated to any project yet or an Issue type scheme which is associated to Global (all unconfigured projects)
# Click "Associate" button without selecting any projects

h3. Expected Results
Show error diagram to tell the user to select one or more projects to associate

h3. Actual Results
500 error is thrown. The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2016-03-31 17:31:15,403 http-nio-17102-exec-1 ERROR      [o.a.c.c.C.[.[localhost].[/].[action]] Servlet.service() for servlet [action] in context with path [/] threw exception [java.lang.NullPointerException] with root cause

The problem appears to be due to concurrent processes.
Running another import may succeed.

Contact support to restore functionality, apply a database fix and run the backup again.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users can no longer create new issues in JIRA even though JIRA Core license is valid, if they expire the trial license of JIRA Service Desk or JIRA Software. I would be better if users can still create new issues if JIRA Core license is valid.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA Core 7.1.2
# Go to JIRA Admin -> Applications -> Version and licenses and install JSD or JIRA Software for trial
# Users can no longer create new issues once the trial license is expired

h3. Expected Results
Users can still create new issues if JIRA Core license is valid.

h3. Actual Results
Users can no longer create new issues once the trial license is expired. They will see the attached error dialog instead.

h3.Workaround
- [Extend JIRA evaluation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRADL/Extending+your+JIRA+evaluation], which is useful only for Server products but not for Data Center products
- Uninstall the application (JSD or JSW) whose license is expired
fields.summary: Cannot create new issues in JIRA due to JSD or JIRA Software license expiry
Linking Issues using Chrome browser

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60386].
  {panel}

The current Project Categories functionality is way too broad of a feature.  It completely overlooks those using modified agile workflows or non-agile workflow such as in JIRA Core.  Also, it fails to handle the possibility that a single status could be used in 2 different projects at 2 completely different locations in a workflow.  Not to mention that it could possibly be used as 2 separate purposes within the same project in 2 different workflows on 2 different issue types.  The possibility that the same status is used as a ending state (done) and an In Progress state in the same project is very slim, but i've actually seen it before.

For example, I have seen a status called "Verified" which in one workflow was used as the final complete state (Done).  However, on a different issue type in the same project it was used as a middle state in the workflow where "Closed" was used as the Done state.  Now, on the global Status level, which category do you assign to the "Verified" state?

Another example is when a single workflow transitions an issue to multiple different job roles.  Therefore, based on the state of the workflow it may be in person1's queue and they have their own To Do, In Progress, Done statuses, but when it is in Done for person1, then it moves to person2's To Do queue where they also have their own In Progress and Done states.  However, with the global category setting, it turns out that both person1's and person2's statuses all end up being "In Progress" and therefore are all colored yellow.  Have you ever seen a dashboard with this new category system in this use case?  Every single status on the entire dashboard is yellow.  How is that beneficial to the user?

The current implementation also falls short on the UI of the statuses, Please return these status names in the UI to Camel Case because all caps is harder to read.  Human eyes are conditioned to read characters in Camel Case and therefore these words are easier to identify at a single glance.  ALL CAPS ARE TOUGH TO READ BECAUSE EACH CHARACTER IS THE SAME HEIGHT AND THEREFORE THE BRAIN NEEDS TO READ EACH CHARACTER SEPARATELY IN ORDER TO DETERMINE THE WORDS.  This is just something that will allow users to be able to quickly identify the status by name since the vast majority, if not all, statuses will be in a yellow state.

With the Categories, you have gone backwards in the ability to quickly identify a status and it's meaning.

On other issues it has been mentioned that the new categories was put in place in order to assist with the new Project Release board which shows the current fix version and a "pretty" blue, yellow, green bar to show the progress of that version.  Since this seems to be the only reason to implement project categories, it just doesn't make sense to do so on the global level.  For the same reasons as above, the project categories could be incorrectly colored for one project, but be correct for another.  Therefore, the Release board is only useful for 1 of those 2 projects.  Therefore, if you want to keep the Release board around, you should shift the category assignments to statuses down to at least the project level if not the project/issue type level.

In summary, the status categories need to be removed or altered to better suit ALL possible uses of JIRA.  Atlassian is making a big push with JIRA Core, JIRA Software, and JIRA Service Desk to make JIRA appealing to all different types of uses, but this functionality goes against that drive and actually hinders it.  Please make a change.
fields.summary: Bring back Status Icons and shift Categories to the project administration/reporting level

fields.description:
h3. Summary
During adding gadget to the Dashboard series of calls to JIRA backend should be initiated. If call to {{/rest/gadget/1.0/statTypes}} fails with the state 'Cancelled', then error handinling is triggered, which causing JavaScript exception _filterId is not defined_, which breaks execution flow and leave _Two dimensional filter_ Gadget in uninitialised state.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Polulate JIRA with large number of CustomFields and Projects 
#  Clear caches via HTTP DELETE on {{rest/internal/1.0/cache/app}} using HTTP basic authentication
# Try to add _Two dimensional filter_ Gadget to the Dashboard. 

h3. Expected Results
_Two dimensional filter_ Gadget shows explicit error that backend call time-out.

h3. Actual Results
 _Two dimensional filter_ is in uninitialised state.
 !gadget_2d_filter.png! 

h3. Notes
Please see [JRA-60312|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-60312] for details of cause of slowness.  

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Two dimensional filter gadget failed in uninitialised state.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Two dimension filter gadget and sorting status is not working in Y-axis. Gadget is not sorting status in alphabetical order.
h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* JIRA version 6.2.7
* JIRA version 7.1.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to dashboard and click add gadget.
# Choose Two Dimensional Filter Statistics and add gadget.
# Choose a saved filter.
# Choose issue type in XAxis.
# Choose Status in YAxis.
# Choose Natural in Sort by column.
# Choose Ascending in soft direction column.
# Enter 5 at number of results column.
# Click Save

h3. Expected Results

The filter result should shows in acceding alphabetical order for issue type and status.

h3. Actual Results
The filter results is not in acceding alphabetical order for status
!filtersort.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Two dimension filter gadget sorting status in alphabetical order is not working

h3. Notes

This is a known bug in the Oracle 12.1.0.2 JDBC driver, as detailed in https://community.oracle.com/thread/3682300. There is a known bug fix that can be requested for Oracle support, 19632480.

h3. Workaround

Install the 12.1.0.1.0 Oracle driver instead (it can be downloaded from [here|http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/database/features/jdbc/index-091264.html]). To install it, copy the driver to your {{JIRA_INSTALL/lib/}} folder and remove the current 12.1.0.2.0 driver.
fields.summary: Installing the Portfolio for JIRA plugin fails using Oracle 12C due to ORA-01000: maximum open cursors exceeded

h3. Problem Definition
Currently , the way Administration searching works , it will go through a tree list . The list started from Applications tabs and end with System tab . When you click JIRA Administration , it will list down Applications , Project , Issues , Add Ons , User Management and System . So , when you typed Support , JIRA will detect the first five matched the word .

h3. Suggested Solution

# Make the search result list more results (maybe 10 instead of 5), rolling list of search results.
# Make it possible to search for category and/or menu-items.
# Make the list of matched menu-items come before the matching categories.
# Renaming of categories and/or menu items so that this won´t conflict.

If a user is selected as Project Lead or is assigned directly to a role, the user still shows up in auto-suggest when using @ mention.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Add user as Project Lead
2. Disable user

6. Try to @ mention user, disabled user does not show up.

h3. Problem Definition
Currently the most of the user experienced with this [JSW-12792|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-12792] bug after they upgraded to Jira 7 and there are no any documentation that stated that Jira Agile add-on in previous version (eg:6.4.x) must be upgraded before upgrade to Jira 7. Also this bug is not mentioned in the Release Note.

h3. Suggested Solution
 # Add the following In the "Release Note" for Jira 7 
[JSW-12792|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-12792] is a known bug.
# Add the following in the upgrade task list of Migration Hub documentation:
JIRA Agile must upgrade to version 6.7.12 before upgrading to JIRA Software 7.1.0 or later

h3. Problem Definition
When JIRA has a significant number of Custom Fields, over 100, it becomes difficult to find/reuse a custom field.  This can causes duplicate Custom Fields to be created by different JIRA admin since an exhaustive search is close to impossible.

h3. Suggested Solution
A simple solution would be to allow the name and type column to be selected and then the contents columns will be put in alphabetical order.

Another solution would be to have a multiple selection field where you could select one or a couple of custom fileld types at a time.
 
h3. Workaround 
None

h3. Problem Definition
Configure JIRA (Core) notification schema to send different mail template for different users. For example to watchers and reporter send email with less data/info (data, event, title...) and to the assignee (and all others), send a full mail with more issue data (data, event, title, due date, description, last comment...)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60348].
  {panel}

In the [JIRA applications and project types overview|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRACloud/JIRA+applications+and+project+types+overview] documentation it is not clearly stated that users with JIRA Software license already have access to all the JIRA Core functionalities and that they don't need another license for this.

The only place where this information is clearly state is the [below post on the atlassian answers website|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/30953879/whats-the-difference-between-jira-software-and-jira]:
{quote}
This is more on licensing. Rather than any product changes/functionality changes
 
JIRA Software : JIRA + JIRA Agile
JIRA CORE : JIRA only without JIRA Agile
JIRA Service Desk: JIRA Service Desk (no changes)
 
Licensing: Previously, if you have 500-user JIRA license, you will need 500 JIRA Agile license as well. Now, no.

Example, in your company, you have 100 user using JIRA and only 30 of them using JIRA+JIRA Agile. You can opt to have 70 user license JIRA Core with 30-user license JIRA Software. Thats why JIRA Core license still exist.

You can still install JIRA Software, and apply only JIRA core license in the license page. And enjoy JIRA functionality without JIRA Agile. And if suddenly you decides that you need Agile capability. Just add the JIRA Software license so you can enjoy Agile functionality. No problem! (smile)
{quote}
fields.summary: It is not clearly stated in the documentation that JIRA Software already includes JIRA Core

h3. Suggested Solution

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As described under known causes for the issue described in [How to fix gadget titles showing as __MSG_gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+fix+gadget+titles+showing+as+__MSG_gadget], broken Application links can cause dashboard gadget title i18n keys not to render properly.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.1+

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure Application Links from JIRA to other applications that have been taken down after i.e. the Application URLs are no longer valid, or there are issues connecting to the remote applications through the applink.
# Go to a JIRA dashboard and observe the display of gadget titles, or scroll down the list of gadgets available in the gadget directory when trying to add a new gadget.


h3. Expected Results
Gadget titles are not affected and display correctly.

h3. Actual Results
Gadget titles display translation keys instead of the actual title e.g. {{__MSG_gadget.activity.stream.title__}} instead of 'Activity Stream'.
The following may appear in atlassian-jira.log file the logs:
{noformat}
2016-02-26 13:48:12,564 http-nio-2186-exec-23 ERROR      [o.a.c.c.C.[.[localhost].[/JSP-262186].[servlet-module-container-servlet]] Servlet.service() for servlet [servlet-module-container-servlet] in context with path [/JSP-262186] threw exception
com.atlassian.templaterenderer.RenderingException: org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: 
Invocation of method 'getText' in  class com.sun.proxy.$Proxy12830 threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at com/atlassian/applinks/oauth/auth/outbound_nonapplinks.vm[line 52, column 44]
    at com.atlassian.templaterenderer.velocity.one.six.internal.VelocityTemplateRendererImpl.render(VelocityTemplateRendererImpl.java:109)
    at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor1986.invoke(Unknown Source)
    at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
    ...
Caused by: org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getText' in  class com.sun.proxy.$Proxy12830 threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at com/atlassian/applinks/oauth/auth/outbound_nonapplinks.vm[line 52, column 44]
    at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.handleInvocationException(ASTMethod.java:337)
    at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.execute(ASTMethod.java:284)
    at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.execute(ASTReference.java:262)
    at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.render(ASTReference.java:342)
    at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.SimpleNode.render(SimpleNode.java:336)
    at org.apache.velocity.Template.merge(Template.java:235)
    at com.atlassian.templaterenderer.velocity.one.six.internal.VelocityTemplateRendererImpl.render(VelocityTemplateRendererImpl.java:100)
    ... 234 more
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.atlassian.jira.i18n.AbstractI18nResolver.getText(AbstractI18nResolver.java:24)
    at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor1918.invoke(Unknown Source)
    at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
    at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
As explained in the KB article above, simply fix the broken Application Links. 
(i) If you continue to see this broken titles after correcting applinks please see the [KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+fix+gadget+titles+showing+as+__MSG_gadget] for other known causes.
fields.summary: Broken Application links can cause dashboard gadget title i18n keys not to render properly

  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, there is no feature to configure the release date and start date when managing version, for example to make it required, as these are not issue field

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option to configure the fields for managing version, for example; set it to required
fields.summary: Having the feature to configure field for managing version

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The project list drop-down does not show tool-tips for the selected project in the create/edit issue dialog

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Open the create issue dialog.
* Hold focus on a project in the project drop-down.

h3. Actual Behaviour

* No tool tip is displayed for the project under focus.

h3. Expected Behaviour
* A tool tip is displayed for the project under focus.

h3. Notes

If the project name is long enough to overflow the width of the drop-down, it is not possible to read the full project name.

h3. Original Description
{quote}
Hi,

Floating tips, which was showing in project field select list dissapeared in JIRA 7.0.10.

In version 6.4.8. everything worked fine. Now, we can only guess what project we try to select, if project have more than circa 32 characters.

It ´s really anoying. Width of field is insufficient and floating tips are now unavailable.

Tom
{quote}
fields.summary: No tooltip is shown for the selected project in the create issue dialog

h3. Problem Definition
Currently JIRA 7 has a new REST API call for user properties. However, as also already stated by the dev in [this comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-45502?focusedCommentId=868389&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-868389], the documentation is not clear on the specifics of this call as explained by the dev in the comment above. 

Therefore users would be attempting to access properties of users created via UI using REST API and also will expect to access properties created via REST API from the UI. However, this is an intended behavior as explained in the  above ticket. 

h3. Suggested Solution
 Please update the doc to clarify the rest call as explained by the dev

  {panel}

h3. Summary

When editing an issue through the filter issue gadget it throws the error:

{code}Error instantiating webwork.multipart.parser.class: com.atlassian.jira.web.JiraMultipartRequestWrapper(original message: null){code}

!60321.png|thumbnail!


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new filter that will return any valid issue.
# Create a new dashboard
# Add a filter issue gadget and select the filter created in the first step.
# Right side of any issue, select the three dots button and Edit.
# In the new edit window, select Update.

h3. Expected Results

The issue would be updated and the screen return to the dashboard.

h3. Actual Results

The issue is update but the UI throws an error.

h3. Notes

This issue is sometimes caused by a permission configuration issue. If you see this issue, ensure the [Jira user has read/write/execute permissions and ownership|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/error-instantiating-webwork-multipart-parser-class-com-atlassian-jira-web-jiramultipartrequestwrapper-when-creating-an-issue-216434167.html] of your installation *work/* and *temp/* folders then restart. If that does not resolve it, then this bug is the cause and the ticket can be edited in a new tab or from a different screen as mentioned in the workaround section.

h3. Workaround

Manually back to the dashboard or open the issue and edit there.
fields.summary: Editing an issue through the filter issue gadget throws an error
Select multiple and right click to Link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-60318].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

After an issue is edited, some users may be notified for this change, which will include the fields that were edited, their previous and new values.

When editing an issue with the ‘Edit’ button (not inline), if both the ‘Description’ and the ‘Assignee’ fields are edited, only the ‘Assignee’ field is included in the notification email.

This was tested with several combination of fields and it seems that the ‘Description’ is always part of the notification, except when the ‘Assignee’ field is also edited. If several other fields are included along with ‘Assignee’ and ‘Description’, only the ‘Description’ is not part of the notification.

This is an example when changing ‘Labels’, 'Summary' and ‘Description’, but not ‘Assignee’:
!no_assignee.png|thumbnail!

If we change the same fields and ‘Assignee’ as well, the ‘Description’ is not included. In the change below, the ‘Description’ was edited in the same operation, but not included in the notification:
!assignee_included.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project and have a user notified for ‘Issue Updated’
# Edit an issue and change its ‘Description’
# Edit it again, changing its ‘Description’ and its ‘Assignee’

h3. Expected Results
Both notifications include the ‘Description’ field being changed.

h3. Actual Results
Only when we don’t include ‘Assignee’ in the change does it include the ‘Description’.

h3.Workaround
Change the ‘Assignee’ in a separate operation.
fields.summary: Editing both Assignee and Description prevents Description from being included in notification

From: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/38048349/answers/38049721

Suggestion: Add a way to set the default view to "List" instead of "Details" for a specific filter.

This would be useful when sharing a filter with others - sometimes I set up a filter to have specific columns with useful information, but when sharing the filter with others the view seems to default to "Details" so other users aren't aware of the customized columns in List view. 

It would be nice to be able to set a default view for the filter, so when other users view the filter they see the customized view.
fields.summary: Ability to set the default view to "List" view for a specific filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an installation has lots of custom fields and a lot of projects, the permission checks for non-admin users cause the call {{/rest/gadget/1.0/statTypes}} to be slow. This call is used by the following gadgets:
* Two Dimensional Filter Statistics
* PieChart
* HeatMap
* Stats

Additionally, there is no AJAX timeout error handling for these gadgets. This causes an exception and the loading indicator is never removed.

h3. Environment
Custom-Fields: 61x
Groups: 46xx
Issues: 1177xxx
Projects: 24xx
Users: 22xxx

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Clear caches via HTTP DELETE on {{rest/internal/1.0/cache/app}} using HTTP basic authentication
# Make the slow call via HTTP GET on {{rest/gadget/1.0/statTypes}}

h3. Expected Results
Response within AJAX timeout (60 sec)

h3. Actual Results
Call {{/rest/gadget/1.0/statTypes}} takes *2-3* sec for admin user and *112* sec for non-admin user.
Massive amount of SELECT like in Sql log:
{noformat}
2016-03-17 07:37:53,216 http-bio-18080-exec-19 user 457x5047x5 1pz5e75 /rest/gadget/1.0/statTypes 0ms "SELECT ID, PID, PROJECTROLEID, ROLETYPE, ROLETYPEPARAMETER FROM projectroleactor WHERE PID='28024' AND PROJECTROLEID='10202'"
{noformat}
Total is *16350* SELECTs:

h3. Initial analysis
There are 3 nested loops
 * For each custom field:
 ** For each project the custom field is bound to:
 *** For each permission scheme entry in this project matching the `BROWSE_PROJECTS` permission:
 **** `SELECT ID, PID, PROJECTROLEID, ROLETYPE, ROLETYPEPARAMETER FROM projectroleactor WHERE PID='$projectId' AND PROJECTROLEID='$schemeEntryParameter'`

There is a short-circuit on each loop, ie. if the permission scheme entry matching `BROWSE_PROJECTS` for the first project for the first custom field says the user has the access, there will be only one `SELECT`.

h3. Workaround
* For global custom fields, the project loop iterates over all projects sorted alphabetically by name (not key) in case-insensitive manner.
To make the project loop short-circuit faster, a test project can be created, with a name, which would place it at the top of the alphabetically sorted project list, e.g. {{aaaa}}.
The user, which suffers from the slowdown, should be given permission to {{Browse Projects}} for the {{aaaa}} project.
This should reduce the number of SQL queries for global custom fields.

* In order to reduce the DB load for non-global custom fields, add the fields to the temporary project. However, all users with the permissions to the temporary project would gain access to all such custom fields.
fields.summary: N+1 performance problem with statTypes REST call

h3. Summary
Certain System fields are always displayed on the View Issue screen, even if they are removed from the Screen configuration.
Example fields: Labels, Priority, Issue Type, Resolution, Description

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Remove any of the fields listed above from the View Issue screen

h3. Expected Results
Field is not displayed on the screen when viewing an issue

h3. Actual Results
Field is still displayed on screen

h3.Workaround
Hide fields from the Field configuration associated to the project
fields.summary: Issue screen displaying extra fields

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In Issue navigator, when you click on a field to select project, type and etc, a drop-down menu appears. The menu stays on the UI when user switch to another filter, until user click on anywhere on the page.

h3. Steps to reproduce (with attached video)
# Go to the issue navigator.
# Click *More*, select *Created Date*
# The Created Date field will have a pop-up box, immediately go to the left panel and select other filters such as *Open Issues*.

h3. Expected result
The pop-up box will not shown in the new filter page.

h3. Actual result
The pop-up box stays on the same position on the page when user switches the filter.
fields.summary: Issue navigator fields drop-down menu doesn't refresh when switching filters

fields.description:
Following this [documentation|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/7.0.10/#api/2/version-createVersion], I was able to create a version in JIRA. However, even I specifically set it as _Released_, JIRA seems not to respect it. The response still says _False_. See the screenshot below:
!6315.png|thumbnail!

Replicating the issue in JIRA 7.1.1 didn't give me the same result. Version was created and released. See the screenshot below:
!711.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: REST API doesn't Release the Created Version
